vortex.utilities

Class Quadtree

  • java.lang.Object
    • vortex.utilities.Quadtree

  • public class Quadtree
extends java.lang.Object
    A data structure much like a binary tree except it splits into 4 rather than 2. This data structure is particularly useful for optimizing collision checks. It can help minimize the number of collision checks done. A naive approach to collision checks results in a O(n^2) algorithm. With this data structure one can reduce it to around O(nlog(n)).
    Author:
    Daniel Stumpff - special thanks to Steven Lambert for his Quadtree example

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the entire tree recursively. This can be expensive so my API doesn't use this method.

      • split

        public void split()
        Splits the current node into 4 smaller nodes.
